\sphinxstylestrong{Farming} project.


\chapter{farming}
\label{\detokenize{modules:farming}}\label{\detokenize{modules::doc}}

\subsection{farming.farm1 module}
\label{\detokenize{farming:module-farming.farm1}}\label{\detokenize{farming:farming-farm1-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!farming.farm1@\spxentry{farming.farm1}}\index{farming.farm1@\spxentry{farming.farm1}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\subsubsection{farm1.py}
\label{\detokenize{farming:farm1-py}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains classes for simulating a farm with multiple cows and pens.
It includes the following classes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Cow}}}}}: A class representing a \sphinxstyleemphasis{cow} with its \sphinxstylestrong{breed}, \sphinxstylestrong{feed type}, \sphinxstylestrong{milk yield}, and \sphinxstylestrong{greenhouse gas emission}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Farm}}}}}: A class representing a \sphinxstyleemphasis{farm} with a list of \sphinxstylestrong{cows} and \sphinxstylestrong{pens}, and methods for \sphinxstylestrong{adding cows and pens},
\sphinxstylestrong{getting pen allocation}, \sphinxstylestrong{milk yield}, \sphinxstylestrong{greenhouse gas emissions}, and \sphinxstylestrong{cost estimation}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Pen}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Pen}}}}}: A class representing a \sphinxstyleemphasis{pen} with its \sphinxstylestrong{breed} and \sphinxstylestrong{cow count}.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module also includes a test suite for testing the functionality of the {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Farm}}}}} class.
\index{Cow (class in farming.farm1)@\spxentry{Cow}\spxextra{class in farming.farm1}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{farming.farm1.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Cow}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{breed}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{feed\_type}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{milk\_yield}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ghg\_emission}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{float}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class represents a \sphinxstyleemphasis{cow} with its {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow.breed}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{breed}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow.feed_type}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{feed\_type}}}}}, {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow.milk_yield}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{milk\_yield}}}}}, and 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow.ghg_emission}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ghg\_emission}}}}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Initialize a new {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Cow}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Cow}}}}} object.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{breed}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The breed of the cow.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{feed\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} The type of feed given to the cow.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{milk\_yield}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The milk yield of the cow in gallons per day.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ghg\_emission}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The greenhouse gas emission of the cow in kg per day.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{Farm (class in farming.farm1)@\spxentry{Farm}\spxextra{class in farming.farm1}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{farming.farm1.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Farm}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class represents a \sphinxstyleemphasis{farm} with a list of {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.cows}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cows}}}}} and {\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.pens}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pens}}}}}, and methods for
adding cows ({\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.add_cow}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_cow()}}}}}) and pens ({\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.add_pen}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_pen()}}}}}),
getting pen allocation ({\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.get_pen_allocation}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_pen\_allocation()}}}}}), milk yield ({\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.get_milk_yield}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_milk\_yield()}}}}}), greenhouse gas emissions ({\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.get_ghg_emissions}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_ghg\_emissions()}}}}}), 
and cost estimation ({\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.farm1.Farm.get_cost_estimation}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_cost\_estimation()}}}}}).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Initialize a new Farm object with empty lists for cows and pens.

\begin{fulllineitems}

\subsection{farming.part2 module}
\label{\detokenize{farming:module-farming.part2}}\label{\detokenize{farming:farming-part2-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!farming.part2@\spxentry{farming.part2}}\index{farming.part2@\spxentry{farming.part2}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\subsubsection{part\_2.py}
\label{\detokenize{farming:part-2-py}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains classes for simulating a special kind of farm with cows.  
It includes the following classes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.part2.Cow}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Cow}}}}}: A class representing a \sphinxstyleemphasis{cow} with its \sphinxstylestrong{breed}, \sphinxstylestrong{feed type}, \sphinxstylestrong{milk yield} attributes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
{\hyperref[\detokenize{farming:farming.part2.Farm}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Farm}}}}}: A class representing a \sphinxstyleemphasis{farm} with a list of \sphinxstylestrong{cows}.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module also includes a test suite.
\index{Cow (class in farming.part2)@\spxentry{Cow}\spxextra{class in farming.part2}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{farming:farming.part2.Cow}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{farming.part2.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Cow}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{breed}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{feed\_type}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{milk\_yield}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{int}}}{}

\chapter{Indices and tables}
